Package io.github.jgame.crypto

Class UserDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.jgame.crypto.UserDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class UserDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Handles logins and encrypts user data using their passcode.
    See Also:

      • hmac

        private static byte[] hmac​(char[] message,
                           byte[] salt)
                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                           java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Hash message with the salt. The salt prevents a dictionary attack.
        Parameters:
        message - Message to hash
        salt - salt
        Returns:
        Hashed message
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - HMAC may fail
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Bad HMAC algorithm
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Bad key supplied.

      • createAccount

        public boolean createAccount​(java.lang.String username,
                             char[] password)
                      throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                             java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initialize an account with random Initialization Vector and salt.

        (Will abort if account already exists.)

        Parameters:
        username - Username to create account for
        password - Corresponding passcode
        Returns:
        Returns true if account creation succeeds.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - No such encryption algorithm
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Invalid encryption key

                       throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                              java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Check if the password matches the account
        Parameters:
        username - Account to check
        password - passcode
        Returns:
        true if the passcode matches the account.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - No such encryption algorithm
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Invalid key supplied

      • getKey

        private javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec getKey​(char[] password,
                                               byte[] salt)
                                        throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                               java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
        Generate a key for encryption from the user's passcode.
        Parameters:
        password - Passcode
        salt - salt
        Returns:
        SecretKeySpec for encryption
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - bad encryption algorithm
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - Bad key!

      • setUserData

        public boolean setUserData​(java.lang.String username,
                           char[] password,
                           java.lang.Object data)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                           java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                           java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                           java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                           javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                           javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Serialize and encrypt the data and store it. - Data is encrypted using key generated with getKey(char[], byte[]) Will abort if password doesn't match the given username.
        Parameters:
        username - Account
        password - passcode
        data - data to store
        Returns:
        true if successful
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Cannot deserialize
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Cannot decrypt (bad key)
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - Invalid params for decryption
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Bad decrypt algorithm
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - Invalid key!
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - Bad block size for block-chaining
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - Bad padding for decryption!

        Check if account exists. No passcode required.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if account exists.

      • deleteAccount

        public boolean deleteAccount​(java.lang.String username,
                             char[] password)
                      throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                             java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Delete account if the passcode is correct.
        Parameters:
        username - Account
        password - passcode
        Returns:
        true if account is successfully deleted.
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Bad algorithm
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Bad key supplied

      • getUserData

        public java.lang.Object getUserData​(java.lang.String username,
                                    char[] password)
                             throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                    java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                    java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                    java.io.IOException,
                                    javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                    javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Retrieve user data stored using setUserData(String, char[], Object) only if the passcode is valid.
        Parameters:
        username - Account
        password - passcode
        Returns:
        Retrieved object. null if passcode verification failed or account doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - The serialized data is corrupt. (unrecognized class in serial)
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - Unrecognized padding supplied
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - Invalid key!
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - Bad params for encrypt!
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Bad algorithm!
        java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - Invalid encrypt key!
        java.io.IOException - Cannot serialize!
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - Bad block size for block-chaining
